comments:
Minor errors

- Internal inconsistency: summary says ~40% drop, table shows ~50% (28.15 → 14.12).

- Cohen’s d sign conventions look flipped (reductions reported with positive d, increases with negative d).

- The “CA4 → RTA” framing is plausible via proximal tubule bicarbonate handling, but genetic causality is not established the way it is for classic inherited RTA genes (for example SLC4A4, CA2). 

- CA4 mutation link to RP17 is real (good), but RTA claim needs stronger sourcing.


Improvement Comments for Next Round

- Reanalyze using plate-matched negative controls for each KO plate; treat well as the unit of replication (mixed model or per-well summary).

- Add basic QC: filter extreme cell area/intensity, edge-touching cells, and segmentation failures; report robustness to thresholds.

- De-risk the MitoTracker readout: distinguish membrane potential vs mass (use multiple mito features beyond intensity; ideally validate with TMRM/JC-1 in follow-up).

- Verify CA4 expression and KO efficiency in U2OS (otherwise phenotype could reflect off-targets or general perturbation stress).

- Strengthen mechanism: directly measure intracellular pH (BCECF-AM or pHluorin) and test whether buffering rescues morphology.

- Validate pathway logic inside JUMP: compare CA2/CA5A/CA5B and key transporters (SLC4A4, SLC9A1, ATP6V), and check whether they phenocopy.
